page.title: 06GRAND UNION CANAL FOXTON
page.content: The Grand Union Canal flows through our block of Leicestershire.At Foxton one can see{FOXTON LOCKS AND THE OLD {INCLINED PLANE SITE. The waterway is maintained by the British Waterways Board and our stretch of the canal is used for pleasure boating,fishing,supplying water to farms,drainage and for carrying goods by barge(NARROWBOAT). No accurate figures for daily use were available from the lock-keeper but there is a counter at the top lock and between May and October of 1984 some 8,000 boats passed through the locks. {FOXTON LOCKS is a famous tourist {attraction advertised in lots of books {and guides to the British country_side {and approximately 250,000 people visit {our area every summer.Boat trips are {run by Mr.T.Matts the owner of Foxton {Boat Service. }
